definitions.definition: that can be trusted to do something well; that you can rely on

examples.text: We are looking for someone who is reliable and hard-working.
He was a very reliable and honest man who would never betray anyone.

definitions.definition: that is likely to be correct or true

examples.text: Our information comes from a **reliable source**.
Prosecution lawyers tried to show that she was not a reliable witness.
How reliable are the local weather forecasts?
These tests are a reliable indicator of future performance.
These measurements are reliable enough for most purposes.
This statement is not reliable as evidence.

definitions.definition: able to work or operate for long periods without breaking down or needing attention

examples.text: My car's not as reliable as it used to be.
It has a highly reliable control system.
There is no reliable supply of electricity or running water.
